Rich,

It's Toban Shokan Koketsu.  It's a copy of an Edo period manuscript.=
  Joly's version of the same MS is called Toban Shinpin Zukan.  I don't hav=
e "TSZ," but I have made a limited comparison of my copy of your book with =
the version of TSZ that Haynes and Harvie are reprinting in the Northern Ca=
lifornia club newsletter.  The numbering is different, but so far I've foun=
d the same guards in each and the text section appears to be the same.  The=
 drawings however are not identical even though they illustrate the same gu=
ards, so they appear to be based on different hand copies of an older MS.

=
I think that one of the comments in the Haynes/Harvie reprint in To Ron men=
tioned that a certain guard was a classic Higo design, even though the sepp=
a dai was narrow like Kyo rather than the usual Higo shape.  The same tsuba=
 in my book had a normal, typical wider Higo seppa dai.  A different brush =
hand at work.

It wasn't unusual for there to be multiple hand copied manus=
cripts made from an original, and no doubt copies were made of the copies. =
 Maybe someone has more specific details on history behind these two books.=

Jim
